VALIDATOR.stakeAnotherValidator: Use the 'Redelegate' feature to instantly stake your assets to another validator.
VALIDATOR.undelegateNotice:
Once the unbonding period begins you will:
- not receive staking rewards
- not be able to cancel the unbonding
- need to wait {{ timeStaking }} day(s) for the amount to be liquid
VALIDATOR.manageNotice:
You can "Delegate" more to this validator
Or use "Redelagate" to switch your assets to another validator.
Or use "Undelegate" to start the unbonding period.

CONTRACT_VERIFY.contractVerifyTitle: Verify & Publish Code ID Source Code
CONTRACT_VERIFY.exitCodeNote: Source code verification provides transparency for users interacting with smart contracts which is instantiated from Code ID source code. By uploading link GitHub source code, Aurascan will match the compiled code with that on the blockchain. Just like contracts, a smart contract should provide end users with more information on what they are "digitally signing" for and give users an opportunity to audit the code to independently verify that it actually does what it is supposed to do.

FEE_GRANT.noticeAddGrant:
If field “Spend Limit Amount” is empty, there is no spend limit and any amount can be spent.
If field “Expiration Time” is empty, there is no expiry date for the granted amount.
FEE_GRANT.noticeRevoke: There is an expired grant allowance between you and this grantee’s address. Need to revoke the expired allowance in order to grant fee to the former grantee. Please note that it takes some times await “revoke” transaction be successful before conducting the next grant action.

PRIVACY_POLICY.intro:
We respect your privacy and are committed to protecting your privacy rights. Please take the time to read our Privacy Policy carefully. We want to be clear about how we use information, and about how you can protect your privacy. To ensure transparency, this Privacy Policy describes our information-handling practices when you access the Software and our Services, as defined below.
References in this Privacy Policy to “Service Provider”, “we”, “our” or “us”, are to Aura Network Limited, a company having an address at Unit 8, 3/F., Qwomar Trading Complex, Blackburne Road, Port Purcell, Road Town, Tortola, British Virgin Islands VG1110 and references to “you”, “your”, “customer”, “Data Subject” or “user” are to the person who is a visitor or a user of the Software and/or our Services. “Services” refer individually and collectively to our website(s), our application programming interfaces (APIs), mobile applications (“Application”) (collectively, the “Software”), and any live support, software, tools, features, or functionalities provided on or in connection with our Services.
By using our Software and/or our Services, including but not limited to downloading one of our mobile Applications, or visiting our website, you express your acceptance of all the terms of this Privacy Policy. Where we require your consent to process your personal information, we will ask for your consent to the collection, use, and disclosure of your personal information as described further below.
PRIVACY_POLICY.notice: BY ACCESSING AND/OR USING OUR SERVICES, YOU AGREE TO BE BOUND BY PRIVACY POLICY. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE WITH THIS PRIVACY POLICY PLEASE LEAVE THE WEB AND/OR UNINSTALL MOBILE APPLICATIONS OR CEASE USING OUR SERVICES IMMEDIATELY.
PRIVACY_POLICY.notice_sub1: All the definitions used in this Privacy Policy shall have the same meaning as in our prevailing
PRIVACY_POLICY.notice_sub2: unless this Privacy Policy sets a different meaning.
PRIVACY_POLICY.1_1Text: We will act as a data controller in relation to personal information about you that may be either provided by you or collected by us.
PRIVACY_POLICY.1_2Text: As a data controller, we will solely determine which of your personal information we will process in corresponding with the purposes and means of the processing of it.
PRIVACY_POLICY.2_theDataCollect: 2. The Data That We Will Collect
PRIVACY_POLICY.2_notice: Please note that not all the information you provide to us is personally identifiable information according to the applicable law.
PRIVACY_POLICY.2_1Text: We may process information about your use of our Services (“Usage Data”). The source of the usage data is our analytics tracking system and your usage of our Services. The Usage Data may include:
PRIVACY_POLICY.2_1_1Text: Your IP address, geographical location, browser type and version, operating system, referral source, length of visit, page views and navigation paths, as well as information about the timing, frequency and pattern of your service use;
PRIVACY_POLICY.2_1_2Text: Your device number, device ID or unique identifier, device type, and unique device token, operating system and applications used, application crash-data, application version, device identifiers such as IDFA (Identifier For Advertisers), Android ID (Android device), referrer URL (Playstore), Google Advertiser ID, device model; and
PRIVACY_POLICY.2_1_3Text: Cookie, which is a small file on your device with a string of letters and numbers which serves as a unique identifier. Sometimes cookies can also be used to store your personal preferences on websites. When you open the Software for the first time, cookies are created on your device. When you open it next time, cookies are sent back to us, thus letting us know you’ve already been there. We don’t create cookies ourselves, but we use third-party providers who do it for us. Cookies make it easier for you to use the Software during future visits. They also allow us to monitor traffic and personalise the content of the Software for you. Session-based cookies only last while your browser is open, and are automatically deleted when you close the browser. Persistent cookies last until you or your browser deletes them or until they expire. Some of our cookies may be necessary for certain uses of the Software. These cookies allow us to make the Software usable by enabling basic functions like page navigation. The Software may not function properly without these cookies. You can generally activate or later deactivate the use of cookies through a functionality built into your web browser or mobile device.
PRIVACY_POLICY.2_1_4Text: Local storage files, including Javascript-enabled local storage, is a typical way for a website to store a small file of letters and numbers in your browser. We use local storage files to keep you signed in at our customer support platform. Local storage files are deleted when the website that stores them deletes them. You can also delete local storage files from your browser at any time you like by visiting your web browser settings.
PRIVACY_POLICY.2_2Text: We may process your account data (“Account Data”). The account data may include your nickname, email address, your user ID. The source of the Account Data is you and our Software that you used to create your Account.
PRIVACY_POLICY.2_3Text: We may process information contained in any enquiry you submit to us regarding the Software and/or our Services (“Enquiry Data”). The Enquiry Data may be processed for the purposes of responding to your enquiry, offering, marketing, correcting any deficiencies in the Software and/or Services and selling relevant services to you.
PRIVACY_POLICY.2_4Text: We may process information contained in or relating to any communication that you send to us (“Correspondence Data”). The correspondence data may include the communication content and your contact information (phone number, social media handle, email address or other social networks or messenger identifiers you use to communicate with us).
PRIVACY_POLICY.2_5Text: We may process information relating to our customer relationships, including customer contact information (“Customer Relationship Data”). The customer relationship data may include your name, your nickname, your contact details (phone number, social media handle, email address or other social networks or messenger identifiers you use to communicate with us) and information contained in communications between us and you. The source of the customer relationship data is you.
PRIVACY_POLICY.2_6Text: We may process your transaction information when you interact with technically supported decentralized protocols and the information you generate through the Software (“Interaction Data”). The source of this data is your activities at or through our Software.
PRIVACY_POLICY.2_7Text: We may process information when we verify your identity (“Verification Data”). This verification data may include your name, address, telephone number, e-mail address, date of birth, national identification number, government identification documents, and, if applicable, information regarding your bank account (such as the name of the bank, the account type and account number). The source of this data is you.
PRIVACY_POLICY.2_8Text: We may process any of your personal information for the purposes as set out in Section 3 below.
PRIVACY_POLICY.3_1Text: The Usage Data may be processed for the purposes of analysing the use of our Services. For cookies, we generally use them for the following purposes:
PRIVACY_POLICY.3_1_iText: authentication – we use cookies to identify you when you visit the Software and as you navigate through the Software;
PRIVACY_POLICY.3_1_iiText: status – we use cookies to help us to determine if you are logged into the Software;
PRIVACY_POLICY.3_1_iiiText: security – we use cookies as an element of the security measures used to protect user accounts, including preventing fraudulent use of login credentials, and to protect the Software and our Services;
PRIVACY_POLICY.3_1_ivText: analysis – we use cookies to help us to analyse the use and performance of the Software and Services; and
PRIVACY_POLICY.3_1_vText: cookie consent – we use cookies to store your preferences in relation to the use of cookies more generally.
PRIVACY_POLICY.3_2Text: The Account Data may be processed for the purposes of providing you access to our Services, ensuring the security of our Services, maintaining back-ups of our databases and communicating with you.
PRIVACY_POLICY.3_3Text: The Correspondence Data may be processed for the purposes of communicating with you and record-keeping.
PRIVACY_POLICY.3_4Text: The Customer Relationship Data may be processed for the purposes of managing our relationships with customers, communicating with customers, keeping records of those communications, and promoting our products and services to customers.
PRIVACY_POLICY.3_5Text: The Interaction Data may be processed for the purposes of providing relevant Services to you.
